page.title: 01 GENERAL - CHESTERTON
page.content: This area is almost totally agricultural with one timber merchant' yard and factory situated on the Fosseway a roman road which runs through the block.The remains of a roman station can only just be found beside the road.There are nine farms in the block which grow a variety of crops and raise many types of animal ranging from chicks to prize winning cattle.The most striking feature in the area is a windmill built for the major landowning family in the 17th century.The lake by the disused watermill has been extended by the present landowner to become a trout fishing lake. The ancient Church which serves the hamlet of Chesterton Green has several interesting tombs and an attractive archway leading from the remains of the medieval manor house and fishponds.
